page.title: 06The Primary School: FINTRY
page.content:
This is Fintry's third location for its school. It received a{Civic Trust {Award}when opened in 1961. The two classrooms were extended in the 60's by two mobiles to accommodate a peak roll of 120.{There are now 77 pupils. There are{four teachers}with help { from{specialists}for PE, music, art, needlework, and remedial tuition.
Children are encouraged to develop a caring attitude to learning, to become {self reliant and appreciate education. There are{four houses,}Graham, Menzies Galbraith and Culcreuch. These compete each term for a cup. There are{school {netball and football teams,}and clubs. The children take part in all local festivals and raise money for charity.
The school kitchen staff also provide{ {"Meals on Wheels"}for senior citizens.
